intro: Aeschynanthus planiculmis, commonly known as the flat-leafed ivy creeper, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and attractive, glossy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically orange or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative trailing plant. Aeschynanthus planiculmis requires well-draining soil and consistent moisture to flourish.
